titleStmt.title: The kind hearted creature: or The prettest [sic] iest that er'e you knew yet Il'e say nothing but what is true: I once heard of a cunning whore, but ner'e the like of this before. To the tune of the Mother beguiled the daughter.
titleStmt.author: Crimsal, Richard.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by A. Mathewes] for F. Coules,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "Al you that are disposed now,".
Printer's name from and publication date conjectured by STC.
In two parts; woodcut illustrations at head of each part.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Author's name sometimes given as Richard Climsell.
